availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Born on July 3, 1832 in Frankfort, Kentucky. In 1850, he was working as a Clerk in Franklin County, Kentucky. at the outbreak of the war, he sided with the Union. Crittenden was commissioned as a Captain in the 4th Cavalry Regiment on August 3, 1861. Promoted to Colonel on March 20, 1863. Mustered out on April 4, 1863 to take a commission in Company S, Kentukcky 12th Cavalry Regiment. He was mustered out on August 23,1865 in Louisville, Kentucky. Crittenden died on August 1, 1873 from wounds sustained at Fort Bowie, Arizona.

bibl.p: Find A Grave, "Eugene Wilkinson Crittenden (July 3, 1832 - August 1, 1873)," Memorial #60333528, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=60333528&ref=acom (accessed June 13, 2017); Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866); 302.
